News

Surge in attendance figures marks seven years of Suffolk Libraries

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jul 30, 2019

This Thursday (1 August) marks seven years since Suffolk Libraries was launched as an independent and charitable organisation which now runs the county’s library service on behalf of Suffolk County Council.

Making Life Better - read about our new strategy

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 16, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has a new strategy for the future.

Suffolk Libraries launches the first ever celebration of the county’s library service

Written by James Powell · Published Jul 11, 2019

Suffolk Libraries has officially launched a day of celebration to generate support for the county’s library service. The first ever Suffolk Libraries Day will take place on Saturday 12 October 2019.

Library service receives special wedding anniversary gift

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jul 10, 2019

Newmarket Library user Samantha Street's family and friends donated £100 to the library as part of her recent pearl wedding anniversary celebrations.

Felixstowe Library to showcase local young people's writing talents at Felixstowe.docs launch

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 27, 2019

An event to celebrate a special book showcasing young people’s writing talents takes place this Friday (28 June) at Felixstowe Library.

Barclays trials banking sessions at Aldeburgh Library

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 26, 2019

Barclays is working with Suffolk Libraries to offer basic banking services at Aldeburgh Library on Mondays from 9am-1pm.

Important changes to our digital magazine services

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 20, 2019

From Wednesday 31 July Suffolk Libraries will no longer subscribe to the RBDigital digital magazine service and from this date you will no longer be able to access this service.

Aldeburgh Library to close for refurbishment

Written by James Powell · Published Jun 18, 2019

Aldeburgh Library will be closed for refurbishment from 24 - 30 June, reopening on Monday 1 July.

'I've witnessed the impact that it has had' – How Open Space is making a difference

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jun 17, 2019

A specialist mental health research charity has found that a successful library-based project is helping to combat loneliness in Suffolk.

'Proud Suffolk' to publish Pride stories

Written by Hannah Foulstone · Published Jun 13, 2019

This Pride Month, we're inviting people from the LGBTQA+ community to publish their stories and experiences with our Proud Suffolk writing project. The project aims to celebrate the community, get their voices heard and promote understanding and acceptance across the county.
